page.title: 01Rural Powys in the 1980's
page.content: Our survey area is located in the heart of rural Mid-Wales. It is in one of the largest counties in Britain called Powys.The land is almost exclusively{farmland}which is intensively managed grassland.The land all lies between 200 metres and 475 metres above sea level. As is often the case in rural communities the very limited number of amenities are concentrated in a very small area- in fact they are all to be found in the one square kilometre that contains the village. Many of the needs of the inhabitants can still be satisfied within the village,though increasingly people look outside to larger communities such as the nearby town of Newtown for employment,recreation and shopping.
